Reviews.Title: “Would go back - nothing bad to point out”
Reviews.Author: Kallaliina
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with some friends for 4 days and I really don't have anything bad to say. This was my third trip to Rome and this was the best hotel. There were two people at the reception and both of them were friendly. This is not always the case, when talking about hotels in Rome...! For some odd reason we were pretty demanding and had to call the reception several times, asking for different things. They provided them each time, without any waiting. Our room was really clean and the sheets were changed everyday. The were plenty of choices at breakfast, which is also not always the case, in italian hotels. There's a metro station close to the hotel, so it's easy to get around. Also a supermarket and a decent restaurant can be found near by. There's an bar/restaurant right next to the hotel. We never ate there, but it was packed with people, so I'm guessin' the food has to be good. The hotel has a small winebar at the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a gem away from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: Welcomeaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Abitart hotel. Our flight was late in the night(landed at 11pm) but it was very convenient to catch the train from the airport(FCO) to Ostiense train station, which is just a few minutes walk away from the hotel. The nearby Pyramide metro station can take you directly to Colosseum. Room and bathroom are very spacious and clean and we also had a private balcony. The design of the whole hotel is artistic as well. Stayed April 2012, traveled with family.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween”
Reviews.Author: Zia_Angelina
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in good position and with clean and well-sized rooms. They were a bit too warm, but it has been a very strange end of October. Only problem was with the pumping disco in the basement whose bass was heard from the fifth floor until 2:30am. Apart from that, the service was commendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when you are in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Seeyen_malaysia
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom are very spacious. Hotel serves very good breakfast & lots of variety. 5mins walk to train station. No coffee making facility in the room. However, you could ask from reception and they are nice to help to provide hot water from lounge at ground floor. The room my travel mates stayed is a bit disappointing because the room wall is painted in dark blue and it makes the room very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be updated”
Reviews.Author: ItalianFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a business trip, so I am always looking for somewhere that has good transport access, has good Wifi and a decent restaurant / bar near by. This hotel, did all that. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the place is very clean. The only downside was the bed linen and bath towels. They were both as old as myself and were as thin as paper. the same went for the pillows. On a positive, the breakfast is fantastic (on a Rome standard). they provide a full continental buffet and not just a few typical cornettos. There is a bar next door which is very good and the place is just behind Ostiense Train station making it very handy. The area itself is average for Rome but if you can, there are some great local restaurants down the side streets. Will I go back.......yes!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - definitely recommending”
Reviews.Author: lelevanda
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for 3 days and stayed at Abitart hotel. The hotel is well located close to the metro station Pyramide and the Ostiense train station. You can get there easily from both of Rome's airports. The rooms are very loungy, love the colours and the design of the whole hotel. A true boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to make wonder.. come here!!”
Reviews.Author: drunked
Reviews.Content: I choosed this hotel cause my girlfriend was so attracted by architecture design...so she was really surprised by this hotel....suite rooms are really large and with good details....really confortable the garage for payment.....elegant estrobar and hall....good quality of breakfast...really warm rooms...hotel close to the metrostation piramide....

Reviews.Title: “Great gem away from the crowds - art lovers take note!”
Reviews.Author: JSudano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The only things I would change about it are that sometimes the staff were not so friendly (it could be the language barrier), and it was not near the city center. However, it really was just a short walk from the Piramide metro station, and the neighborhood, while being described as "up and coming" or whatever else they call it, was safe. I was a bit wary of staying here after reading all the reviews and descriptions of this area being "up and coming" or "renewed", because in Austin, the areas that are described as such are still unsafe and not very nice. We were pleasantly surprised. There is graffiti everywhere, on all the buildings, so it gives the image of being much more dangerous and gritty than it actually is. But the people around were kind and we never felt unsafe. Also, a cab ride to Trastevere (and great restaurants there) is only maybe 7 to 10 Euros, which was great. The staff were nice, and always answered our questions, but sometimes we felt as if we were bothering them. It may have been because we don't really speak Italian, and only English. Still, the customer service was good. Our room at Abitart was spectacular. We had the clouds/sky suite (room 504), with a private balcony, huge bathroom, and large, comfortable room. The artwork in the room was beautiful, and the furniture and lighting just added to the ambiance. We had no idea we were going to get a room like this, as we booked a "superior double" and not a "junior suite", but maybe we were upgraded? Either way, it was amazing. My only complaint about the room was that it was dark at night, since there was no direct overhead lighting available in the bedroom area. Some pluses include a digital "Do Not Disturb" button, door lock button, large bathroom with beautiful blue tiles, big LCD flatscreen TV, and good dark curtains in case we wanted to sleep in. The breakfast at the hotel was nothing great, but it was free and did the job in the mornings. The eggs were tasty, although they were usually cold or had just run out. Stick to the mini pastries or bread with salami and cheese, juices, cereals, yogurt, and tea/coffee. All in all, we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel and its decor and comfort. If I ever return to Rome, I will definitely be staying here again. It was an excellent value for the money, and it was great to escape the tourists to a quiet, beautiful refuge in Ostiense.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it...Need some renovation”
Reviews.Author: SmartTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: Hotel definitely not hip. Really need some renovation. Bed is not comfortable (very small & pillow is too thin). There are many poor designs including the bathroom where water will get into the bedroom and flooded the bathroom cause of the poor bath design. I keep getting hurt from hitting the many sharp corners from the bed or table. The good thing about this hotel is the room is big. Our room air-contioner is just too noisy which sucks....

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel close to train and subway”
Reviews.Author: Heri_SE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the outside of Rome, but very close to train station (to airport) and also about 10 min walk to the subway. A prefect stay if you don´t want do pay overprice to stay in the city center. We waked one day from Coloseum to the hotel, and it took about 30 min. The hotel is very modern, high standard and the room we stayed in, was very good. We also tried the restaurant and can highly recommend it! There are good restaurants in the nearby streets as well. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. The staff gave their best all the time. Very friendly and service minded. I would go back to this hotel if I am going to Rome agagin!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley6CO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. It was very modern with a very arty theme to it. Our room was on the green floor and it was clean , painted green with a sky muriel painted on the ceiling. Breakfast was plentiful with choices of fruits, yoghurt, pastries, breads etc scrambled egg and bacon. Great start to our days. The nearest metro Pyramide was 5/10 min walk down the main road depending on your speed. The main Oestience train staion is the same distance so easy to walk from the station when you arrive from the airport F. Great hotel. would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel- great service”
Reviews.Author: lea5834
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Abitart for three weeks for work. The location was convenient, although not in the heart of central rome, very close to the subway so getting around was very easy. The best part of the stay was the hospitality shown by the front desk workers. All the workers were very friendly, personable and helpful. Rooms were pleasant, but seemed to vary greatly room to room. Rooms were cozy though which is important when being gone on business for three weeks. The beds were ok, not the most comfortable ever (had two twins pushed together to make a larger bed) but they were comfortable enough. One drawback was the lack of a fitness center, although there was one accessible across the street. Would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: gulfcoastie
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and conveinient. The staff helped us greatly on our arrival. While waiting for the rest of our extended family to arrive (Sunday), we were overheard by the staff wondering if and where we could go to mass. Within moments they got us the information we needed, got us a cab with a driver who spoke modest English, but gave us a great running narrative as he took us to St. Peters. We made mass and were so greatful! Our group did have a lovely breakfast buffett (but I don't know if we paid or not). Rooms were very nice, beds were great, and the property immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: MWlshw
Reviews.Content: Having had a good tour with Riviera Travel before, we felt some confidence in them using the Abitart for their Rome tour despite the negative comments in other reviews. I can understand them, especially if staying here alone on business. The area is a bit scruffy, but the hotel is spotless and has examples of modern art all over, even the shape of the rooms! I found the staff very friendly and helpful. Despite the Expedia web site, smokers are discouraged but we were moved to a balcony room so that we could puff away without upsetting anyone. Also, there is no tea/coffee in the room, although mentioned on Expedia. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for refurbishment so can't comment on the food except breakfast was adequate, typical continental plus scrambled eggs. There are several restaurants if you turn left out of hotel, then first left after crossing main road. Don't use the main road one, called something like La Manga, we had problems even though it was nearly empty. Should have given us a clue! I don't see anywhere on Trip Advisor to record comments on Riviera Travel but we were very happy with the tour saving us queing for tickets, excellent guide, avoiding crowds, well organised.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Toesinthesand1966
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The room was clean and spacious. The room was awesome and they have free internet in the lobby. The staff at the front desk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: PowerandPasta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Abitart for 3 nights and had a very good experience. Front desk staff (3 different people) were all very friendly: highlighted maps for us, detailed bus routes, and recommended a local restaurant. Room was clean, beds comfortable and enough space for us to relax. We booked through a travel agent who requested a quieter side of the building, so no problem with noise. And, no problem with booking not being honoured. Free internet in the lobby was a nice extra. The location was fine for us ... #60 bus took us directly to the Coliseum and other tourist attractions. We did not use taxis and were able to walk from the Coliseum to Spanish Steps etc. Breakfast was simple, but exactly what we like ... good strong coffee, cereal, yogurt and dolce. The Ostiense train station is the closest when coming from Rome airport. When you exit the train station, head to the left and go down the street (bit of sloping street going down and I don't know the name). At the bottom of the street, turn left and go under the overpass. At the next light you will see the Abitart across the street and a bit to your left. Not hard to find. Enzo's is a restaurant close by that had very good local cuisine. Doesn't open until around 8pm, but well worth the wait. We would stay here again and would recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: businessCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a four star hotel suited towards business travellers. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were large, and it had all the amenities such as chocolates at night, nice shampoo, etc. The shower was really excellent. Breakfast is a buffet offering a large assortment of cereals, yogurt, fruit, pastries, juices, and scrambled eggs large sun room. It was all very nice. We found the staff to be reasonably friendly and had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Others in our party found the staff rude and the hotel not up to the standards of a 4 star. Having to open the windows meant the rooms were noisy at night, and they were on the hot side, but this was the only negative we experienced. It was a short walk to the bus stop, but the subway was further. We found the buses were a very convenient way to travel around the city. Buy your bus pass at the tobacconist around the corner from the hotel. There's a grocery store next door to the hotel - a convenient place to buy wine or bread and cheese for a picnic lunch. I wouldn't stay here if I had a choice, simply because of the price, but overall it was very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get to stay: hotel did not honour booking. Confirm and REconfirm here!”
Reviews.Author: NicC
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place a 2* based solely because they offered us a free dinner in recompense for not honouring our booking. If not, it would have got one only. We booked some time ago via internet, got a confirmation and we also reconfirmed. When we arrived in Rome, our friends who had also booked a room told us that they had no rooms for us, and had also turned other people away. The alternative hotel they sent our friends to was dingy and horrible, so they returned and waited for us. My husband and the other guy then went to argue it out. Being Italian this was easier for them - other people just got turned away. FINALLY, we were offered 2 rooms in a hotel in another part of Rome, and a dinner on the house (for 6 of us). The hotel we were sent to - River Chateau in Flaminio area - turned out to be very nice so in the end we got an OK deal. At the time it wasn't amusing and I'm sure we only got this because we mentioned the word 'avvocato'. Again, perhaps the fact the hotel knew that we were Italian meant that we could actually put our money where our mouths were. It's a shame we didn't get to stay there. The lobby area was fantastic and very modern. The restaurant was excellent - food very good - and great loos. Made us wish we were staying there. I don't know what happened at the Abitart to make all these rooms unavailable, but I do know that having to argue with hotel reception was very tiring. I wouldn't risk booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Like The Location”
Reviews.Author: maxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abitart March 3-6, 2006. Hotel - Nice rooms, but hot, very noisey area - if you're not on the back side of the hotel - you won't sleep. Good bathrooms, hard beds and pillows. Breakfast was good. Restaurant attached: expensive, need reservations, rude staff Front desk: spoke English, not very friendly Location: BAD....if you're in the city to as a tourist - very bad location. 20 euro taxi to the Vatican Musuem.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress this enough about this so-called hotel - please do not waste your money. We stayed there stayed for 3 nights in May 2005. I had phoned ahead to reserve a specific suite in the hotel for our stay. When we got here around 6pm to check-in, they informed us the suite was not ready and asked if we would mind staying in another suite and our suite would be ready in the morning. We reluctantly agreed. The next morning, we went down to reception to swop keys back to our own suite but once again were informed that it was not ready. Obviously unhappy at this, they assured me it would ready within the hour. 20 mins later they claimed the suite was ready and we checked in. We had a great day in Rome and returned later around 11pm to go to bed. Upon getting into bed, we were horrified to discover the sheets had not been changed and there was actually blood stains on the sheet. After calming down a little, I immediately contacted the night porter who changed the sheet to the best of his ability. The next morning I charged down to reception to comfront the hotel manager. Not only was he dis-interested and pretty un-apologetic, he had the audacity to accuse us of putting the blood there ourselves because we were unhappy that our suite wasnt ready! Have you ever heard anything like that in your life? I am not a violent person but that just about tipped me over the edge. Bottom line - do not give these people your well earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: chillipepper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in Rome. I searched for days looking at different hotels for Rome and ended up staying at this hotel. Both myself and my husband loved the hotel. The staff were great and the area we found to be brilliant! Our room was a blue room and had a walk in wet room shower! Which was perfect for cooling our feet after a long day walking! The area around the hotel was great as after walking all day the last thing we wanted to do was walk on a night. There were about 10 restaurants around our hotel in the back streets which were really authentic and served brilliant food and were really cheap compared to the city restaurants. The hotel is only a short walk from Pyramide Metro which is 2 stops from the colloseum and 5 from Termini. The lido train also went from Pyramide station. A word of warning about anyone wanting to use the Terravision/Ryanair service from Ciampino! We waited over an hour to leave the airport and other passengers had waited over 2 hours for the return coach!!! Definately would use the train/metro next time! Breakfasts at the hotel were ok but not brilliant! Make sure you eat early or there isnt much choice left. The rooms were spotless! Ask for a quiet room away from the main road but there again all hotels in Rome are noisy. We never encountered any pickpockets but i think you just have to be weary and keep your eyes open all the time on the Metro.

HotelInfo.Name: Abitart Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Pellegrino Matteucci 10 / 20 | (Piramide Cestia), 00154 Rome, Italy
